page.title: 03HISTORIC BUILDINGS
page.content: Mackenzie family in 1750. However an outhouse dated c.1500 suggests thatthe site has been occupied for more than 41/2 centuries and that this is the latest of a series of houses. The link with the Mackenzies is shown by the Stag's Head crest and the motto "Ferendum sperandum es". Early in this present century the front of the house was destroyed by fire - the work of an arsonist who also killed a young girl running to a nearby farm for help. This is the origin of one of the three ghosts reputedly in the house; the others are a lady in blue and a nurse. The front was rebuilt about 1920. Like all 'big houses' Kincraig had its gardens both functional and ornamental: the former produced fruit and vegetables,the latterwas planted with exotic shrubs and trees. In 1965 Kincraig House was sold and
